thread.title: Dayton’s LGBT Film Festival celebrates 10th year
thread.title_full: Dayton’s LGBT Film Festival celebrates 10th year | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Meredith Moss
title: Dayton’s LGBT Film Festival celebrates 10th year
text:
Ten years ago, when Dayton’s downtown priority board asked him come up with an idea for a new film series, Jonathan McNeal offered a suggestion. Because he’d just been touring the country with his own film, “The Rubi Girls,” McNeal had realized Dayton had no film series targeting the LGBT community.
“I told them that if they were interested, I would seek out other sponsors and create a package of films that were fresh and new, and otherwise absent from the community,” said McNeal, manager of The Neon movie theater in downtown Dayton. “They agreed.”
Continue reading on MyDaytonDailyNews.com. »
